qas.question: What radio format was described as being "the acoustic equivalent to Prozac"?
What decade saw the birth of the soft adult contemporary format?
What radio station introduced the term "soft rock"?
Where was the station that introduced the term "soft rock" based?
What processed meat, featured in WEEI-FM's ad slogan, rhymes with Joni?

context: Termed "the acoustic equivalent to Prozac", <a0_0>soft adult contemporary<a0_0/>, a more adult-oriented version of AC, was born in the late <a1_0>1970s<a1_0/> and grew in the early 1980s. <a2_0>WEEI-FM<a2_0/> in <a3_0>Boston<a3_0/> was the first station to use the term "soft rock", with ad slogans such as, "Fleetwood Mac ... without the yack" and "Joni ... without the <a4_0>baloney<a4_0/>". The vast majority of music played on soft AC stations is mellow, more acoustic, and primarily solo vocalists.
